paragraphs.content: Chapter 31
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 31

paragraphs.content: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
paragraphs.contentHtml: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

paragraphs.content: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

paragraphs.content: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

paragraphs.content: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

paragraphs.content: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

paragraphs.content: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.

paragraphs.content: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

paragraphs.content: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

paragraphs.content: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour’s door;

paragraphs.content: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

paragraphs.content: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

paragraphs.content: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

paragraphs.content: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

paragraphs.content: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

paragraphs.content: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

paragraphs.content: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

paragraphs.content: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

paragraphs.content: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;)
paragraphs.contentHtml: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother’s womb;)

paragraphs.content: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

paragraphs.content: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

paragraphs.content: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

paragraphs.content: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.

paragraphs.content: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

paragraphs.content: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

paragraphs.content: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

paragraphs.content: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

paragraphs.content: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:

paragraphs.content: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

paragraphs.content: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

paragraphs.content: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

paragraphs.content: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

paragraphs.content: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.

paragraphs.content: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:

paragraphs.content: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

paragraphs.content: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.

paragraphs.content: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

paragraphs.content: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

paragraphs.content: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

paragraphs.content: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

paragraphs.content: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
